results.abstract: Serge Schmemann Editorial Observer column recalls deification in Soviet Union of Yuri Gagarin, first man in space, in light of China's launch of its first astronaut, Lt Col Yang Liwei; see launch mainly aimed at lifting standing of China's rulers at home and with world; recalls Gagarin's feat ultimately did Soviet state and Gagarin little good (M)

headline.main: Editorial Observer; What China's First Man in Space Should Learn From Cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin

results.snippet: I don't know how many of them remain, but when I was a correspondent in the Soviet Union in the 1980's, there wasn't a single city, town or even village across the entire 11 time zones that didn't have a Gagarin Street. Many also had Gagarin Squares,...
results.lead_paragraph: I don't know how many of them remain, but when I was a correspondent in the Soviet Union in the 1980's, there wasn't a single city, town or even village across the entire 11 time zones that didn't have a Gagarin Street. Many also had Gagarin Squares, quite a few had Gagarin Institutes or Gagarin Schools, and many had Gagarin statues. Moscow's was a particular atrocity: a stainless steel Flash Gordon atop a soaring column in the center of a smoggy traffic circle. No Soviet figure, except the deified Lenin, was more exalted in the Soviet firmament than Yuri Gagarin, the first man in space. A major part of his allure for the creators of official myths, of course, was that he was not a political figure, and so not subject to retroactive debunking, like every Soviet ruler after Lenin.

results.snippet: INTERNATIONAL   A3-18    U.S. Surveillance Project To Counter Iraqi Ambushes  A new American surveillance effort, called Project Eyes, is looking at a range of tactics and technology to try to detect and counter the increasingly deadly ambushes...
results.lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-18 U.S. Surveillance Project To Counter Iraqi Ambushes A new American surveillance effort, called Project Eyes, is looking at a range of tactics and technology to try to detect and counter the increasingly deadly ambushes against forces in Iraq. A1

results.abstract: Rev Tom Reiber-Martinez letter on parallels between Yuri Gagarin's first orbit of Earth and China's recent feat

headline.main: China Takes a Step Into Space. What's Next?

results.snippet: To the Editor:    Serge Schmemann's observations about the parallels between Yuri Gagarin's first orbit of the Earth and Yang Liwei's recent feat (''What China's First Man in Space Should Learn From Cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin,'' Editorial Observer, Oct....
results.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Serge Schmemann's observations about the parallels between Yuri Gagarin's first orbit of the Earth and Yang Liwei's recent feat (''What China's First Man in Space Should Learn From Cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin,'' Editorial Observer, Oct. 23) are on target.
